doc.title: China Industrial Bank Co. Ltd. (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/China Industrial Bank Co. Ltd. A 1H25 profit growth turned positive while PPOP decline narrowedChina Industrial Bank Co._2025-08-29

passages.text: Maintain Rating: UNDERPERFORM | PO: 21.67 CNY | Price: 2.77 CNY

CIB's 1H25 net profit rose \(0.2\%\) YoY (vs - 2.2% in 1Q), \(1.6\%\) higher than BofAe. 1H25 pre- provision profit (PPOP) fell \(3.0\%\) YoY (vs - 4.3% in 1Q), \(0.8\%\) below BofAe. ROE fell 0.9ppt YoY to \(10.2\%\) in 1H. CET1 ratio rose 6bp YoY to \(9.54\%\) partly helped by CB conversion. Maintain Underperform on uninspiring results.

NII fell \(4.5\%\) QoQ, with gross interest income/expense down \(3.6\% /2.8\%\) QoQ. CIB's reported adjusted NIM was \(1.75\%\) in 1H25, 11bp/7bp lower than 1H24/FY24 levels, and largely in line with its full year target of - 10bp YoY decline. Loans grew \(1.5\%\) QoQ/4.1% YoY. Corporate loans rose \(6.6\%\) HoH, retail loans fell \(1.4\%\) (dragged by card loans - 8.1%, while mortgage loans \(+0.3\%\) ) and discounted bills dropped \(10.6\%\) Assets fell \(0.2\%\) QoQ/ rose \(2.6\%\) YoY. Deposits grew \(4.3\%\) QoQ/9.0% YoY with time deposit mix up 2.1ppt HoH to \(56.1\%\) . Net fee income grew \(2.6\%\) YoY in 1H (vs \(+8.5\%\) in 1Q), with custodian & trustee fee up \(14\%\) YoY while card fees down \(16\%\) YoY. The YoY decline of other non- NII narrowed from - 21% in 1Q to - 7% in 1H with the rebound of bond market. Revenue fell \(2.3\%\) YoY, operating cost edged down \(0.1\%\) , and CIR rose 0.6ppt YoY to \(27.0\%\) in 1H.

NPL ratio was flattish QoQ at \(1.08\%\) , while SML ratio fell 5bp QoQ to \(1.66\%\) . Gross NPL formation rose to 106bp in 1H25 vs 93bp/90bp in 1H24/FY24. Corporate real estate loan/exposure declined \(3.8\% /2.8\%\) HoH to RMB456bn/724bn ( \(7.7\% /6.8\%\) of total loans/assets) with NPL/NPA ratio up 36bp/16bp HoH to \(1.90\% /4.05\%\) . LGFV exposure fell \(28\%\) HoH to RMB75bn ( \(0.7\%\) of total assets) with NPA ratio up 76bp HoH to \(4.67\%\) but no new NPL formation. Retail NPL ratio declined 13bp HoH to \(1.22\%\) with mortgage /card loan NPL ratio down 6bp/36bp HoH to \(0.54\% /3.28\%\) . Credit cost increased from \(0.92\%\) in 1H24/FY24 to \(0.97\%\) in 1H25. NPL coverage/loan reserve ratio declined 4.9ppt/6bp QoQ to \(228.5\% /2.46\%\) . Total provisions fell \(12\%\) YoY in 1H25 as non- loan provisions (mostly related to debt investment) dropped \(79\%\) YoY from a high base.

Banks-Multinational/Universal

China Industrial Bank (CIB) is one of the largest joint stock banks (JSB) in China in terms of asset size. Founded in 1988, the bank is based in Fuzhou, Fujian province, with more than 2,000 branches and 54,000 employees. It is a full service bank, providing a range of commercial banking, investment banking and services.

We rate CIB at Underperform. CIB has one of the highest loan-deposit ratio and the highest interbank funding mix among peers, which are not favorable in a rising market rate environment. The large fee income gap from legacy WMPs will drag on revenue growth this year. Credit cost cut is not sustainable and the provision coverage ratios have kept declining.

Our PO of CNY21.67 is based on 0.53x 2025- 26E P/B, which is derived from an adjusted Gordon Growth model that assumes an average ROE of \(9.3\%\) , a medium- term growth rate of \(4.0\%\) , and a cost of equity of \(14.0\%\) . At our PO, the stock would be trading at \(5.9x 2025 - 26E P / E\) or \(3.0x 2025 - 26E P / PPO\) .
Downside risks to our PO are a sharp margin decline, higher- than- expected credit costs in its interbank assets, and significant deterioration in system- wide asset quality.
Upside risks to our PO are continued rapid asset size growth, improving deposit franchise, and better capital position.
